org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.commons.adt

Class ObservableListManager<E extends javafx.beans.Observable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.commons.adt.ObservableListManager<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ListListener<E>, ObservableListListener<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ObservableFileListManager, Playlist, SongsManager

    public class ObservableListManager<E extends javafx.beans.Observable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObservableListListener<E>
    Represents a manager that is responsible for notify listeners about the changes to the underlying list.

    This manager implements itself the ObservableListListener interface so that it can handle the changes to the items (in addition to callback the listeners). Anyhow, actually this implementation does nothing but notify the listeners.

      • mListChangeListener

        protected final javafx.collections.ListChangeListener<E extends javafx.beans.Observable> mListChangeListener
        Listener of the list.

        This is kept so that the list can be listened and unlistened at any time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObservableListManager

        public ObservableListManager()
        Creates a new list manager and initializes the underlying list.

      • ObservableListManager

        public ObservableListManager(boolean makeListObservable)
        Creates a new list manager and optionally initializes the underlying list by adding a listener to it that detect the changes.

        This constructor may be useful in case the elements of the list have to be loaded before make the list observable (this avoid to fire the callback to onElementsAdded(List) which may be unneeded the for the first load).

        Parameters:
        makeListObservable - whether this entity listen to the changes to the underlying list and thus reports those

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(ObservableListListener<E> listener)
        Adds a listener that will be notified when changes to the list are made.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that will listen to the list's changes

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(ObservableListListener<E> listener)
        Removes a previously added listener from the listener set.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that won't listen to the list's changes anymore

        Returns:

      • onElementsAdded

        public void onElementsAdded(java.util.List<? extends E> es)
        Description copied from interface: ListListener
        Called when elements are added to the list.

        If multiple items are added at the same time (e.g. with List.addAll(int, Collection) this method is called just once for all the elements.

        Specified by:
        onElementsAdded in interface ListListener<E extends javafx.beans.Observable>
        Parameters:
        es - the added elements

      • onElementsRemoved

        public void onElementsRemoved(java.util.List<? extends E> es)
        Description copied from interface: ListListener
        Called when elements are removed from the list.

        If multiple items are removed at the same time (e.g. with List.removeAll(Collection) this method is called just once for all the elements.

        Specified by:
        onElementsRemoved in interface ListListener<E extends javafx.beans.Observable>
        Parameters:
        es - the removed elements

      • onElementsChanged

        public void onElementsChanged(java.util.List<? extends E> es)
        Description copied from interface: ObservableListListener
        Called when elements are updated in the list.

        The changes to the list's elements are detected via the Observable interface which is implemented by the elements.

        If multiple items are updated at the same time (e.g. with List.replaceAll(UnaryOperator) this method is called just once for all the elements.

        Specified by:
        onElementsChanged in interface ObservableListListener<E extends javafx.beans.Observable>
        Parameters:
        es - the changed elements

        protected void stopListObservation()
        Stops to listen to the underluing list changes.
